story:
Once upon a time, in a small village nestled in the heart of a lush, verdant valley, there lived a kind and curious little girl named Maria. Maria was known throughout the village for her warm heart, her quick wit, and her love of animals. She had a special gift for understanding and communicating with all creatures, big and small.

One day, as Maria was exploring the woods that bordered the village, she came across a tiny, quivering bird with a broken wing. Maria gently scooped up the injured creature and cradled it in her hands, whispering soothing words and promising to take care of it.

She brought the bird home and made a cozy nest for it in a small basket. She carefully tended to its broken wing, feeding it and keeping it warm, until one day, the bird was well enough to fly again.

But this bird was no ordinary bird. It was a magical creature, sent from the heavens to grant Maria one wish. Maria thought long and hard about what she wanted more than anything in the world. She had a happy life, with a loving family, and plenty of friends, but there was one thing that she wished for with all her heart: to be able to help all the creatures of the world, no matter how big or small, far or near.

The magical bird listened intently, and then, with a nod of its head, it granted Maria's wish. From that moment on, Maria was able to understand and communicate with every creature, from the tiniest ant to the largest elephant. She became a champion for all animals, working tirelessly to protect their habitats, and to ensure their safety and well-being.

Maria's gift brought joy and peace to the village, and to the world beyond. The villagers honored her as a hero, and the creatures of the earth, sky, and sea hailed her as their guardian angel.

And so, Maria lived a long, fulfilling life, surrounded by the creatures she loved, and beloved by all. When it was time for her to leave this world, the magical bird returned to take her to the heavens, where she was welcomed with open arms, and where she continued to watch over all the creatures she had come to love.

From that day on, whenever a creature was in need, it would look up to the heavens and see Maria, smiling down upon it, ready to lend a helping hand.

So, my dear daughter, always remember to cherish the creatures of this world, and to treat them with kindness and compassion. For just as Maria discovered, the joy and love we share with our animal friends can bring light and happiness to all.

And with that, my dear one, it is time for you to close your eyes and drift off to sleep, knowing that the world is a magical place, full of wonder and possibility. Goodnight, my sweet little one, and may your dreams be filled with love and adventure.
